name: Cole's High-Performing Hook Patterns
creator: Cole
description: 7 proven hook formulas that consistently stop scroll and drive engagement

hook_types.name: Bold Outcome Hook
examples: I wrote 100 LinkedIn posts in 30 days and got 50K followers.
I deleted my calendar and 3x'd my productivity.
I quit my $200K job to write full-time. Best decision ever.
hook_types.when_to_use: When you have a counterintuitive result to share

hook_types.name: Contrarian Question
examples: What if posting daily is killing your growth?
What if you don't need 10K followers to make $100K?
What if the best writers don't write every day?

hook_types.name: Specific Number Hook
examples: 0 followers → 15K in 6 months. Here's the system:
$0 → $50K MRR in 9 months. The playbook:
100 posts → 1M impressions. What I learned:
hook_types.when_to_use: When you have concrete before/after data

hook_types.name: Mistake Admission
hook_types.format: I [mistake] for [time]. Here's what I learned:
examples: I ghostwrote for free for 6 months. Biggest mistake of my career.
I built the wrong product for 2 years. Here's what I'd do differently:
I ignored my email list for 3 years. Cost me $500K.

hook_types.name: Pattern Interrupt
hook_types.format: Everyone does X. I do Y instead.
examples: Everyone focuses on growth. I focus on retention.
Most creators batch content. I write in real-time.
People say 'be consistent.' I say 'be strategic.'

hook_types.name: Tease Framework
examples: The 3-step framework that got me 100K followers:
The email template that converts at 40%:
The pricing strategy that 5x'd my revenue:
hook_types.when_to_use: When teaching a system or process

hook_types.name: Urgent Observation
hook_types.format: In [timeframe], [trend] will [change]. Here's how to prepare:
examples: In 6 months, AI will replace 80% of content writers. Here's how to stay relevant:
By 2025, organic reach will be dead. Build your email list now.
This pricing model is dying. Switch before it's too late.

hook_principles: Specificity beats vagueness (use numbers, names, timef rames)
Curiosity gap (tease what's coming without giving it away)
First 8 words determine if people keep reading
strategic_insights: Bold Outcome Hooks work best on LinkedIn (professional results)
Contrarian Questions perform well on Twitter (debate culture)
Specific Number Hooks are universal (concrete = credible)
Mistake Admission builds trust faster than success stories
Pattern Interrupt positions you as thought leader
First sentence should be <15 words for mobile readability
Test hooks with GPTZero - aim for 80%+ human score

testing_framework.step_1: Write 3 variations of your hook using different patterns
testing_framework.step_2: Pick the one with most specificity + stakes
testing_framework.step_4: Read it out loud (if it sounds unnatural, rewrite)
testing_framework.step_5: Check: Does it create curiosity without clickbait?

common_mistakes: Being vague ('I learned something important about business')
No stakes ('I tried a thing and it worked okay')
Giving away the punchline in the hook
pro_tips: Add time pressure: 'in 30 days', 'overnight', 'by next week'
Name drop when relevant: 'Stripe uses this', 'from Y Combinator'
Break grammar rules if it sounds better
